Discovery Incidents

When the Veil Between Worlds Fails

Classification: Separation Failures
Frequency: Increasing
Threat Level: Variable (Minor to Existential)

⚠️ BREACH DOCUMENTATION WARNING

The following records document instances where the Great Separation has failed, temporarily or permanently. These incidents represent the greatest ongoing threat to both supernatural security and human stability. Knowledge of these patterns is restricted to Sanctuary personnel and authorized supernatural entities only.

When Separation Fails

Discovery Incidents represent moments when the carefully maintained separation between supernatural and mundane reality breaks down. These breaches range from minor perception gaps that affect single individuals to catastrophic failures that threaten to expose the supernatural world to humanity at large.

Critical Understanding

Discovery Incidents are not random occurrences. They follow predictable patterns and are increasing in both frequency and severity. The current rate suggests a fundamental instability in the separation itself, potentially leading to complete systemic failure within decades.

Historical Context

Since the Great Separation in 1307, there have been over 2,847 documented Discovery Incidents of various classifications. The rate has accelerated dramatically since the Industrial Revolution, with 67% of all recorded incidents occurring since 1900.

Current Statistics (2020-2025)

  • Class I Incidents: 847 (Minor cognitive barrier failures)
  • Class II Incidents: 156 (Localized supernatural exposure)
  • Class III Incidents: 23 (Regional separation failures)
  • Class IV Incidents: 3 (Major dimensional breaches)
  • Class V Incidents: 0 (Civilization-threatening exposures)

Why This Matters

  • Escalating Threat: Each incident weakens the overall separation structure
  • Pattern Recognition: Understanding causes allows for better prevention
  • Resource Management: Containment operations require enormous resources
  • Long-term Planning: Current trends suggest inevitable major breach within 30-50 years

Notable Incident Clusters

1847-1860: The Edinburgh Cluster - 47 incidents following the first major breach

1914-1918: The War Years - 123 incidents as global conflict stressed separation barriers

1947-1952: The Roswell Period - 89 incidents coinciding with increased human technological capability

1999-2001: The Millennium Surge - 134 incidents around global belief events

2020-Present: The Current Crisis - 1,029 incidents and counting

Related Entries

  • The Great Separation - Original creation of current system
  • Sanctuary Forces - Primary containment organization
  • The Surge - Current escalation crisis
  • Cosmic Hierarchy - Power structure maintaining separation

Incident Classification System

The Sanctuary employs a five-tier classification system for Discovery Incidents, based on scope, severity, and containment requirements. This system was developed after the Edinburgh Incident and refined through centuries of field experience.

Class I: Individual Cognitive Breakthrough

Scope: Single individual or small group (1-5 people)

Duration: Minutes to hours

Containment: Memory modification or recruitment

Resource Cost: Low

Description: Individual humans temporarily overcome cognitive barriers and perceive supernatural activity. Most common form of breach, often triggered by extreme stress, supernatural proximity, or natural sensitivity.

Typical Manifestations:

  • Seeing through supernatural disguises or illusions
  • Perceiving supernatural entities normally invisible to humans
  • Temporary awareness of magical activity
  • Recognition of supernatural influence on events

Standard Response:

  • Immediate assessment of individual's sensitivity level
  • Memory modification for low-sensitivity individuals
  • Recruitment evaluation for high-sensitivity individuals
  • Monitoring for recurring breaches

Class II: Localized Supernatural Exposure

Scope: Neighborhood to city district (dozens to hundreds)

Duration: Hours to days

Containment: Area containment and mass memory modification

Resource Cost: Moderate

Description: Supernatural events become visible to significant numbers of mundane humans within a localized area. Usually caused by supernatural conflicts, entity manifestations, or dimensional instabilities.

Common Causes:

  • Supernatural entity battles in populated areas
  • Magical rituals gone wrong
  • Dimensional portal opening in public spaces
  • Reality anchor failure or sabotage

Containment Requirements:

  • Rapid response team deployment
  • Area cordoning using official cover stories
  • Mass memory modification operations
  • Media suppression and evidence cleanup

Class III: Regional Separation Failure

Scope: Entire city or geographic region (thousands to hundreds of thousands)

Duration: Days to weeks

Containment: Regional lockdown and massive resource deployment

Resource Cost: High

Description: Complete breakdown of separation barriers across a significant geographic area. Supernatural reality becomes consistently visible to all humans in the affected region.

Triggering Events:

  • Major supernatural entity manifestation
  • Cascading reality anchor failures
  • Dimensional overlay collapse
  • Large-scale ritual interference

Emergency Protocols:

  • Joint Sanctuary-Coalition response teams
  • Regional communication blackouts
  • Mass population management
  • Potential area evacuation and memory restructuring

Class IV: Major Dimensional Breach

Scope: National to continental (millions to billions)

Duration: Weeks to months

Containment: Global coordination and extraordinary measures

Resource Cost: Extreme

Description: Fundamental failure of separation structure affecting vast geographic areas or global communication networks. Represents immediate threat to the continued existence of separated reality.

Historical Examples:

  • The Edinburgh Incident (1847) - First documented Class IV
  • The Tunguska Event (1908) - Dimensional impact from Primordial activity
  • The Philadelphia Experiment (1943) - Government supernatural research gone wrong

Response Measures:

  • Global supernatural coalition activation
  • Potential Primordial intervention
  • Mass reality restructuring
  • Timeline manipulation if necessary

Class V: Civilization-Threatening Exposure

Scope: Global (entire human civilization)

Duration: Permanent unless reversed

Containment: Unknown - theoretical only

Resource Cost: All available

Description: Complete and irreversible failure of the Great Separation. Supernatural reality becomes permanently visible to all humanity simultaneously. This classification exists only in theory, as no Class V incident has ever occurred.

Potential Triggers:

  • Complete supernatural coalition collapse
  • Primordial intervention against separation
  • Human technological breakthrough overriding all barriers
  • Cascading failure from multiple simultaneous Class IV incidents

Theoretical Responses:

  • Emergency Great Working to restore separation
  • Managed revelation protocols
  • Potential human civilization reset
  • Unknown - preparation plans classified beyond this documentation level

⚠️ Classification Creep

Recent analysis shows that incident classifications are trending upward. Events that would have been Class I in 1950 now regularly reach Class II severity. This suggests systematic weakening of separation barriers rather than isolated failures.

Historical Major Incidents

These case studies represent the most significant Discovery Incidents in recorded history. Each provides crucial insights into separation failure mechanisms and containment strategies.

The Edinburgh Incident (1847)

Classification: Class IV

Duration: 3 weeks

Affected Population: ~200,000

Containment Cost: Establishment of the Sanctuary

Event Summary:

Dr. Elisabet Thorne's research team at Edinburgh University accidentally created a dimensional rift while experimenting with electromagnetic fields. The breach allowed direct observation of the supernatural overlay dimension and attracted multiple high-tier entities to the city.

Key Developments:

  • First scientific documentation of dimensional layers
  • Mass supernatural sightings throughout Edinburgh
  • Direct contact between humans and supernatural entities
  • Breakdown of cognitive barriers across the entire city

Containment Measures:

  • Emergency intervention by the Original Family and Fae Courts
  • Complete memory restructuring of 200,000 people
  • Official cover story: "Unusual Aurora Phenomena"
  • Formation of human-supernatural cooperation protocols

Long-term Impact:

The Edinburgh Incident led to the formal establishment of the Sanctuary as a neutral organization for managing human-supernatural relations. It also demonstrated that separation failures could be contained, but only through massive resource expenditure and unprecedented cooperation.

The Tunguska Event (1908)

Classification: Class IV

Duration: Instantaneous explosion, 6 months of aftereffects

Affected Population: ~50,000 across Siberia

Containment Cost: Russian Imperial and Soviet resources

Event Summary:

A Primordial entity's experimental dimensional manipulation resulted in a catastrophic energy release over the Siberian wilderness. The explosion was equivalent to 10-15 megatons and created a dimensional instability that persisted for months.

Supernatural Causes:

  • Primordial "stress-testing" of reality structures
  • Dimensional boundary collapse across 2,150 square kilometers
  • Reality anchor network overload and cascade failure
  • Temporary merger of multiple dimensional layers

Containment Strategy:

  • Remote location limited initial exposure
  • Russian government cooperation in area cordoning
  • Scientific cover story development (meteorite impact theory)
  • Long-term monitoring and gradual reality stabilization

Lessons Learned:

Tunguska demonstrated that Primordial activity could threaten separation stability. It led to the development of early warning systems for high-tier entity activity and established protocols for cooperation with national governments during major incidents.

The Philadelphia Experiment (1943)

Classification: Class III (upgraded from initial Class II)

Duration: 2 weeks

Affected Population: ~12,000 (naval personnel and civilians)

Containment Cost: Joint US Navy-Sanctuary operation

Event Summary:

US Navy experiments with "invisibility technology" accidentally discovered methods for dimensional manipulation. The USS Eldridge briefly phased between dimensional layers, creating widespread separation failures in the Philadelphia area.

Technical Details:

  • Electromagnetic field manipulation affected reality anchors
  • Ship and crew temporarily existed in supernatural overlay
  • Cascading cognitive barrier failures across the region
  • Multiple supernatural entities drawn to investigate

Government Response:

  • Immediate classification of all research at highest levels
  • Sanctuary consultation and joint containment operation
  • Extensive witness interviews and memory modification
  • Official denial and disinformation campaign

Significance:

This incident marked the first time a national government had independently discovered dimensional manipulation technology. It led to formal Sanctuary-US government cooperation agreements and established protocols for managing government supernatural research.

The Chernobyl Convergence (1986)

Classification: Class III

Duration: 4 months

Affected Population: ~350,000 (evacuees and emergency workers)

Containment Cost: Soviet government resources plus supernatural coalition support

Event Summary:

The nuclear reactor explosion created an unexpected interaction between radioactive energy and supernatural forces. The accident site became a dimensional weak point that attracted entities from multiple reality layers.

Supernatural Complications:

  • Radiation interfered with reality anchor functioning
  • Exclusion zone became visible from supernatural overlay
  • Emergency workers experienced widespread supernatural encounters
  • Several entities were drawn to the high-energy environment

Joint Containment Effort:

  • Soviet authorities unknowingly aided in supernatural containment
  • Sanctuary teams operated under cover of disaster response
  • Reality anchors redesigned to function in radioactive environments
  • Long-term monitoring established disguised as radiation studies

Ongoing Effects:

The Chernobyl Exclusion Zone remains a dimensional weak point. Regular Sanctuary monitoring continues under the cover of radiation research, and the area serves as an early warning system for supernatural activity in Eastern Europe.

⚠️ Pattern Recognition

Analysis of major incidents reveals concerning trends: increasing frequency, higher base classification levels, and reduced time between occurrences. The interval between Class IV incidents has decreased from 61 years (Edinburgh to Tunguska) to 8 years (multiple recent near-Class IV events).

Incident Patterns and Causes

Seven centuries of documented Discovery Incidents have revealed predictable patterns and identifiable trigger mechanisms. Understanding these patterns is crucial for both prevention and rapid response strategies.

Primary Trigger Categories

1. Technology-Induced Failures

Frequency: 34% of all incidents

Trend: Rapidly increasing

Description: Human technology accidentally interfering with separation mechanisms, reality anchors, or dimensional barriers.

Common Technological Triggers:
  • High-energy physics experiments
  • Advanced electromagnetic field generation
  • Quantum computing research
  • Military radar and communications systems
  • Medical imaging equipment in sensitive individuals
Why Technology Affects Separation:

The separation barriers operate on dimensional frequencies that certain human technologies can accidentally disrupt. As technology advances, the risk of interference increases exponentially.

2. Supernatural Entity Activity

Frequency: 28% of all incidents

Trend: Stable but severity increasing

Description: Direct supernatural actions that overwhelm local separation barriers or attract attention from mundane humans.

Entity-Related Triggers:
  • Conflicts between supernatural entities in populated areas
  • Powerful entities manifesting in the mundane layer
  • Large-scale magical rituals or summonings
  • Dimensional travel accidents
  • Territory disputes affecting reality anchor placements
Escalation Factors:

Modern supernatural entities are more powerful than historical averages due to accumulated age and resources. Their conflicts create proportionally larger separation strains.

3. Human Collective Events

Frequency: 19% of all incidents

Trend: Increasing with population growth

Description: Large-scale human emotional or belief events that stress cognitive barriers through collective unconscious pressure.

Collective Event Triggers:
  • Global catastrophes and mass trauma events
  • Religious gatherings and spiritual movements
  • Major cultural celebrations or commemorations
  • Widespread media events that capture global attention
  • Social movements involving transcendent beliefs
Mechanism:

When millions of humans experience similar intense emotions simultaneously, their collective unconscious can overpower local cognitive barriers, creating spontaneous breaches.

4. Natural Sensitive Individuals

Frequency: 12% of all incidents

Trend: Significantly increasing

Description: Humans born with natural resistance to cognitive barriers, whose abilities can trigger local separation failures.

Sensitivity Manifestations:
  • Spontaneous supernatural perception
  • Psychic abilities that affect reality anchors
  • Natural magical talent in bloodlines
  • Inherited connections to supernatural entities
  • Unusual electromagnetic signatures that disrupt barriers
Growing Population:

Each generation produces more naturally sensitive individuals. Current estimates suggest 1 in 10,000 humans have some level of natural resistance to cognitive barriers.

5. Infrastructure Failures

Frequency: 7% of all incidents

Trend: Stable but more severe

Description: Mechanical or magical failures of the reality anchor network and cognitive barrier maintenance systems.

Infrastructure Failure Types:
  • Reality anchor power source depletion
  • Cascade failures from single anchor destruction
  • Sabotage by hostile supernatural entities
  • Natural disasters affecting anchor locations
  • Dimensional stress causing systematic overloads
Modern Challenges:

The reality anchor network was designed for much smaller human populations. Current load levels are approaching system limits, increasing failure frequency.

Geographic Distribution Patterns

High-Risk Zones

  • Major Population Centers: Stress on cognitive barriers from dense human concentration
  • Technological Research Hubs: Higher probability of technological interference
  • Ancient Supernatural Sites: Dimensional barriers naturally weaker
  • Geological Fault Lines: Tectonic activity affects reality anchor stability
  • High-Energy Locations: Power plants, military installations, research facilities

Temporal Patterns

  • Lunar Cycles: 23% increase during full moons
  • Seasonal Variations: Higher rates during equinoxes and solstices
  • Historical Anniversaries: Spikes on dates significant to supernatural history
  • Time Zone Clustering: Incidents often occur in groups within 6-hour periods

Predictive Modeling

Current Sanctuary models suggest a 73% probability of a Class IV incident occurring within the next 15 years, with a 12% chance of a Class V event by 2050. These predictions are driving increased investment in prevention technologies and containment protocols.

Containment Protocols

Effective containment of Discovery Incidents requires rapid response, precise execution, and extensive resources. The Sanctuary has developed standardized protocols refined through centuries of field experience and technological advancement.

Immediate Response (0-4 Hours)

Detection and Assessment

  • Automatic Detection: Reality anchor network alerts trigger immediate notifications
  • Human Reports: Monitoring of emergency services, social media, and news outlets
  • Supernatural Intelligence: Entity network provides early warnings of planned activities
  • Classification Assessment: Rapid evaluation determines resource allocation needs

Initial Containment

  • Rapid Response Teams: Sanctuary units deployed within 30 minutes of detection
  • Perimeter Establishment: Area cordoning using appropriate cover stories
  • Witness Management: Immediate identification and isolation of affected individuals
  • Evidence Suppression: Digital media monitoring and removal

Active Containment (4-24 Hours)

Memory Modification Operations

The primary tool for managing human exposure to supernatural reality. Technology and techniques vary based on incident scale and affected population characteristics.

Individual Memory Modification:
  • Neuralizer Technology: Precise memory editing using electromagnetic field manipulation
  • Chemical Protocols: Targeted amnesia induction combined with false memory implantation
  • Magical Methods: Entity-assisted memory modification for supernatural-resistant individuals
  • Psychological Conditioning: Therapeutic techniques for complex or traumatic exposures
Mass Memory Operations:
  • Broadcast Modification: Large-area electromagnetic field generation affecting entire populations
  • Water Supply Treatment: Temporary amnesia compounds distributed through municipal systems
  • Atmospheric Dispersal: Airborne agents affecting cognitive function in targeted areas
  • Collective Unconscious Manipulation: High-tier entity assistance for major operations

Reality Anchor Repair and Reinforcement

Addressing the underlying cause of most separation failures through infrastructure maintenance and enhancement.

Emergency Repairs:
  • Mobile anchor units for temporary barrier restoration
  • Rapid replacement of damaged or destroyed permanent anchors
  • Network rerouting to compensate for failed nodes
  • Power boost protocols for overloaded systems
Reinforcement Measures:
  • Additional anchor placement in high-risk areas
  • Upgraded power sources and backup systems
  • Enhanced monitoring and early warning systems
  • Redundant network architecture to prevent cascade failures

Long-term Management (24 Hours - Ongoing)

Cover Story Development and Maintenance

Creating believable alternative explanations for witnessed supernatural events that satisfy human curiosity while preventing further investigation.

Cover Story Categories:
  • Natural Phenomena: Weather events, geological activity, atmospheric anomalies
  • Technological Explanations: Experimental aircraft, industrial accidents, military exercises
  • Social Events: Flash mobs, performance art, promotional activities
  • Criminal Activity: Terrorism, organized crime, drug-related incidents
Maintenance Requirements:
  • Media coordination and story seeding
  • Government liaison and official statement coordination
  • Expert testimony and scientific explanation development
  • Long-term monitoring for story effectiveness

Affected Individual Monitoring

Continued surveillance of humans who experienced supernatural exposure to prevent recurring breaches or awareness recovery.

Monitoring Protocols:
  • Regular psychological evaluation and memory integrity assessment
  • Social media and communication monitoring
  • Medical record tracking for anomalous health changes
  • Career and life pattern analysis for supernatural interest development
Intervention Triggers:
  • Memory modification failure or partial recovery
  • New supernatural exposure incidents
  • Active investigation into supernatural topics
  • Contact with other aware individuals or organizations

Specialized Containment Scenarios

Government Involvement

When national or local governments become aware of supernatural activity, specialized protocols ensure cooperation while maintaining overall separation.

  • Diplomatic contact with appropriate government liaisons
  • Classified briefings with limited supernatural information
  • Joint operation agreements with resource sharing
  • Long-term cooperation treaties for ongoing management

Media Exposure

Managing supernatural content that reaches mass media requires rapid, comprehensive response across multiple channels.

  • Digital content removal and platform cooperation
  • Broadcast media intervention and story replacement
  • Print media coordination and distribution control
  • Social media monitoring and influencer management

⚠️ Resource Strain

Current containment operations consume 67% of total Sanctuary resources. The increasing frequency and severity of incidents is approaching the organization's operational limits. New funding sources and efficiency improvements are critical for maintaining current containment capabilities.

Prevention Strategies

While containment protocols manage incidents after they occur, prevention strategies aim to reduce the frequency and severity of Discovery Incidents through proactive measures and systematic improvements to separation infrastructure.

Infrastructure Enhancement

Reality Anchor Network Modernization

Upgrading the global reality anchor system to handle modern population levels and technological interference.

Current Modernization Projects:
  • Generation IV Anchors: 300% more efficient with self-repair capabilities
  • Quantum Entanglement Networks: Instantaneous communication between anchor nodes
  • AI Monitoring Systems: Predictive failure analysis and automatic optimization
  • Renewable Power Sources: Solar, geothermal, and dimensional energy harvesting
Expansion Plans:
  • 50% increase in anchor density by 2030
  • Underwater and stratospheric anchor placement
  • Mobile anchor platforms for rapid deployment
  • Backup network architecture with 99.9% uptime guarantee

Cognitive Barrier Strengthening

Improving the mental conditioning that prevents supernatural perception in baseline humans.

Enhanced Conditioning Methods:
  • Subliminal Media Content: Reinforcement messaging in entertainment and news media
  • Educational Curriculum Design: Scientific materialism emphasis in schools
  • Pharmaceutical Interventions: Supplements in water supplies that strengthen barriers
  • Cultural Programming: Promoting skepticism toward supernatural claims
Adaptation Strategies:
  • Generation-specific conditioning for digital natives
  • Cultural sensitivity adaptations for different populations
  • Resistance to emerging technologies that threaten barriers
  • Counter-programming against supernatural media influence

Human Factors Management

Sensitive Individual Identification

Early detection and management of humans with natural resistance to cognitive barriers.

Identification Methods:
  • Genetic Screening: Bloodline analysis for supernatural heritage markers
  • Psychological Testing: Perception tests disguised as academic or employment assessments
  • Electromagnetic Monitoring: Detection of unusual bioelectric signatures
  • Behavioral Analysis: Pattern recognition in medical and education records
Management Approaches:
  • Recruitment: Integration into Sanctuary operations
  • Enhanced Conditioning: Specialized memory modification programs
  • Lifestyle Guidance: Career and location suggestions that minimize exposure
  • Monitoring: Lifelong surveillance for breakthrough incidents

Technology Threat Mitigation

Managing the increasing risk from human technological advancement that could compromise separation.

Research Monitoring:
  • Embedded Sanctuary personnel in major research institutions
  • Government liaison programs for military and space research
  • Corporate infiltration of technology companies
  • International coordination on dangerous research identification
Interference Strategies:
  • Funding Redirection: Steering research away from dangerous areas
  • Equipment Sabotage: Preventing experiments that could breach separation
  • Personnel Management: Recruitment or elimination of key researchers
  • Result Suppression: Preventing publication of dangerous discoveries

Supernatural Entity Cooperation

Coalition Maintenance

Ensuring continued supernatural support for the separation system through diplomatic and economic incentives.

Incentive Programs:
  • Territory Guarantees: Formal recognition of supernatural domains
  • Resource Sharing: Access to human technology and knowledge
  • Conflict Mediation: Neutral arbitration of inter-entity disputes
  • Security Cooperation: Joint response to existential threats
Enforcement Mechanisms:
  • Economic sanctions against non-compliant entities
  • Coalition pressure and diplomatic isolation
  • Threat of exposure to rival entities
  • Military action as last resort

Rogue Entity Management

Dealing with supernatural entities that threaten separation through deliberate or careless actions.

Identification Systems:
  • Intelligence networks monitoring entity behavior
  • Pattern analysis of incident triggers
  • Collaborative intelligence sharing with coalition members
  • Early warning systems for high-risk entity activity
Intervention Options:
  • Diplomatic Resolution: Negotiation and incentive offers
  • Coalition Pressure: Peer intervention and sanctions
  • Containment Operations: Forced isolation from human populations
  • Elimination: Last resort for incorrigible threats

Long-term Strategic Planning

Alternative Coexistence Models

Research into possible alternatives to the current separation system for long-term sustainability.

Model Categories:
  • Graduated Revelation: Slow integration over generations
  • Elite Awareness: Limited supernatural knowledge for human leadership
  • Technological Equality: Human advancement to supernatural-equivalent capabilities
  • Dimensional Segregation: Complete physical separation of populations
Research Priorities:
  • Social psychology studies on supernatural acceptance
  • Technology assessment for coexistence support
  • Entity negotiation for alternative arrangements
  • Timeline analysis for optimal transition periods

Crisis Contingency Planning

Preparation for scenarios where prevention and containment fail, requiring emergency measures to preserve some form of separation.

Contingency Scenarios:
  • Cascade Failure: Multiple simultaneous Class IV incidents
  • Coalition Collapse: Loss of supernatural cooperation
  • Technology Breakthrough: Human discovery of dimensional manipulation
  • Mass Awareness Event: Global supernatural exposure
Emergency Protocols:
  • Emergency Great Working preparation
  • Primordial intervention request procedures
  • Global communication shutdown capabilities
  • Managed revelation implementation guidelines

Success Metrics

Prevention success is measured by incident frequency reduction, severity limitation, and system sustainability. Current targets include: 50% reduction in Class I incidents by 2030, elimination of Class IV incidents for 20+ years, and development of sustainable long-term coexistence models by 2050.
